title: Why Facebook Shares Gained 10.6% in the First Half of 2020
text: Although the social media giant posted strong numbers, it now has to contend with an advertiser boycott.

title: Big Tech CEOs Head Back to Capitol Hill
text: The chief executive officers of Amazon.com Inc., Facebook Inc., Alphabet Inc. and Apple will testify on July 27 before a U.S. congressional panel investigating competition in the technology industry. Rep. Ken Buck, a Republican from Colorado, discusses the House Judiciary Antitrust Subcommittee's investigation. He speaks on "Bloomberg Technology."

text: The social network's commitment to civil rights is questioned after a two-year review.

title: Facebook would be in 'way better shape' adopting Twitter's disinformation response, ex-Facebook security chief says
text: Alex Stamos, who left Facebook in 2018 over its handling of misinformation in the 2016 election, said Mark Zuckerberg is confusing fighting amplification with censorship.

text: Facebook has a wide base of advertisers to reduce concentration risk, limiting the impact of a few blue chip advertisers pausing ad spend.

title: Barry Diller Says Google Needs Regulation, Won't Join Facebook Ad Boycott
text: Barry Diller, chairman and senior executive of Expedia Group Inc. and IAC/InterActive Corp., discusses his views on big tech monopolies and the movement to boycott advertising on Facebook. Diller speaks exclusively with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Front Row."

title: Facebook faulted for ‘significant’ civil rights setbacks, audit reveals
text: The auditors blasted Facebook's policy of not fact-checking posts from politicians in the interest of protecting free expression over equality and non-discrimination — an approach they called "deeply troubling."

title: Advertising boycott isn't going to hurt Facebook if it only lasts for one month, says Douglas Alexan
text: CNBC's Jon Fortt talks with Shelley Willingham-Hinton of the Douglas Alexandra Agency about Facebook's civil rights audit that discovered "serious setbacks."

title: Instagram pounces on India market after TikTok is banned
text: TikTok has had a difficult week, to say the least — and rival Instagram just made it much harder.

title: Facebook audit paints 'deeply troubling' picture of company's response to Trump posts, civil rights issues
text: Facebook continues to operate with glaring blind spots for hateful content and misinformation on the site and has made a number of decisions in the last year that "represent significant setbacks for civil rights," according to a highly anticipated audit of the company's practices.

title: 'Weaponized' Facebook fails to protect civil rights, audit says
text: Facebook Inc has not done enough to protect users from discrimination, falsehoods and incitement to violence, an external civil rights audit found on Wednesday, adding to pressure on the company in the midst of an advertiser boycott.

title: Taboola CEO: Facebook should hire more content reviewers, not depend on AI
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg sat down for a virtual meeting with the organizers of the "Stop Hate for Profit" advertising boycott. The campaign is a protest against the social media company's content moderation policies. Adam Singolda, founder and CEO of native advertising platform Taboola, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss.

title: Germany insists self-regulation not enough for Facebook
text: Germany is determined to expand its attempts to regulate online hate speech even as Facebook promises to do more to clean up its site after a global advertiser boycott, with politicians saying the issue is too important to leave to self-regulation.

title: Advertising Boycott Likely To Continue As Civil Rights Groups And Facebook Fail To Make Progress At Talks
text: Talks held Tuesday between civil rights groups and Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) did not yield results, increasing the likelihood that the advertising boycott campaign targeting the social media giant will continue beyond July.

title: Facebook expands Instagram Reels to India
text: As scores of startups look to cash in on the content void that ban on TikTok and other Chinese apps has created in India, a big challenger is ready to try its own hand. Instagram said on Wednesday it is rolling out Reels — a feature that allows users to create short-form videos set to […]
